page.title: 01COUNDON and LEEHOLME
page.content:
Coundon Leeholme and Leasingthorne are villages in COUNTY DURHAM situated near the town of BISHOP AUCKLAND. }Most of the surrounding area is now farmland with a few small plantations.
However there is ample evidence of a former industrial past where the remains of quarries and coal mines scar the countryside. Most of these are now derelict, but a few have been adapted for use by small industries.
The area has one claim to fame from the past. WINDLESTON HALL was the birthplace (on June 12 1897) of ANTHONY EDEN a former prime minister.
Today the only famous residents are racehorses which are trained at the village of Leasingthorne.
